description.narrative: An ongoing conflict between Georgia and its South Ossetia province escalated into military action between the Russian Federation and Georgia on 7 August 2008. Consequently, military operations in South Ossetia, Georgia proper and Abkhazia have led to the displacement of over 100,000 people, as estimated by both the Government of Georgia and Russian Federation figures (12 August 2008). Civilian casualties, whilst difficult to ascertain in the current security context, have been estimated by the International Red Cross as 2,000 killed and 35,00 injured. The current security environment is undermining humanitarian access and making evacuation of casualties and civilians difficult.
